poem:
Title: "In Stone Shadows"

Vestige of an old empire tarnished not,
Portland Place, a thoroughfare of power,
Echoes now of those who sought
To build on conquered culture's hour.
Whispers of a club exclusive,
Echoed in the architect's chisel,
Decolonise or remain elusive,
As walls crumble, truths drizzle.
Within stony folds, a redundant narrative,
In new dawn, we collectively live.
